Summary Mitch is a Legal Director in the Intellectual Property (IP) Group at Hewlett-Packard Company (HP). He manages the team of HP IP Transaction attorneys that provides legal support for HP Labs (the advanced research and development arm of HP); HP Cloud Services; patents sales and acquisitions; and patent, technology and standards licensing at HP. Mitch is also the senior Company lawyer supporting HP Labs for research collaborations with the U.S. Government and universities and research institutions worldwide. 
 
Prior to joining HP, for more than 10 years at Sun Microsystems, Mitch served as lawyer for 3 Executive Vice Presidents, supporting Sun's Chief Technology Officer (Sun Labs and advanced R&D organizations), Sun's largest hardware product group (strategic transactions and development/release of new products), and Worldwide Operations (manufacturing and supply chain operations for server and storage products). 
 
Prior to joining Sun, Mitch was in private practice for 20 years in Washington, DC and the Bay Area, serving as a partner in 2 major law firms. Mitch provided litigation and counseling services to companies engaged in aerospace, computer hardware/software, telecommunications, and electronics on complex government contracts with U.S. military and civilian agencies. Specialties:Technology licensing, intellectual property law, government contracts, manufacturing and supply chain matters, R&D contracting, regulatory compliance, export controls.
